title: Accrual vs. Cash Accounting – Timing Differences
description: A company performs $10,000 of consulting work in December but receives cash payment in January. Under accrual accounting, how much revenue is recognized in December?
hint: Revenue is recognized when work is performed, not when cash is received.
explanation: Revenue is recognized in December because that’s when the work was performed. Cash basis would recognize it in January. Accrual basis = performance period.
interviewAngle: This concept shows up often when reconciling net income to cash flow. Accrual vs. cash timing is tested in SaaS, services, or 3-statement model walk-throughs.

learnContent.coreConcept: Accrual = when work is done; Cash = when payment is received.
learnContent.howItWorks: If service is performed, it's accrual revenue. Cash received later shows up in CFO.
learnContent.whyItMatters: This affects the income statement vs. cash flow timing. Common modeling point in interviews.
